reviews.review_msg: multiple choice questions on exam are very hard but it is balanced off by easier written questions and an easy %30 in lab. try downloading the ta's notes and then listening to the lecture tapes.  the material is actually quite straight forward with the notes prior to listening.
Exams are impossible! Study as much as you want/can, and you are merely looking at a pass.

take good notes and ask a lot of questions and you should do fine.  Tests are very hard. Big plus, no text book to buy.  He appears to be near the pinacle of current knowledge for this topic.  If you're interested in memory, Whittlesea's the one to take
alot of info to learn, tests are brutal, TA helps alot

Probably the smartest professor at SFU.   She should definitely be better recognized and appreciated by the school. This is a 'must' course for SFU psyc majors. Not because it is easy, (it isn't) but because it is informative and so well organized.
So hard to understand. Very unorganized and stutters a lot.. made learning the content very hard
